diseases.name: Acne
diseases.description: Acne is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells.
treatments: Topical creams and gels containing benzoyl peroxide or retinoids
Oral medications such as antibiotics or isotretinoin

diseases.name: Appendicitis
diseases.description: Appendicitis is a condition where the appendix becomes inflamed and swollen, usually as a result of an infection.
symptoms: Pain in the lower right side of the abdomen

diseases.name: Arthritis
diseases.description: Arthritis is a condition where one or more joints become inflamed, causing pain, stiffness, and limited range of motion.
symptoms: Swelling and redness around the joint

diseases.name: Asthma
diseases.description: Asthma is a chronic condition where the airways in the lungs become inflamed and narrow, making it difficult to breathe.
treatments: Bronchodilators to open up the airways

diseases.name: Atherosclerosis
diseases.description: Atherosclerosis is a condition where plaque builds up inside the arteries, making them narrower and restricting blood flow.
treatments: Lifestyle changes such as quitting smoking and eating a healthy diet
Medications to lower cholesterol and blood pressure
Angioplasty or stenting to open up blocked arteries

diseases.name: Bronchitis
diseases.description: Bronchitis is an inflammation of the lining of the bronchial tubes, which carry air to and from the lungs.

diseases.name: Cataracts
diseases.description: Cataracts are a clouding of the eye's natural lens, which can cause blurry vision and eventually blindness if left untreated.
symptoms: Frequent changes in eyeglass or contact lens prescription
treatments: Surgery to remove and replace the clouded lens

diseases.name: Celiac disease
diseases.description: Celiac disease is an autoimmune disorder in which the body's immune system attacks the small intestine when gluten is ingested, leading to damage and malabsorption of nutrients.

diseases.name: Cirrhosis
diseases.description: Cirrhosis is a late stage of liver disease in which healthy liver tissue is replaced with scar tissue, impairing liver function and leading to a range of symptoms.
symptoms: Loss of appetite and weight loss
Jaundice (yellowing of the skin and eyes)
treatments: Treatment of underlying causes (e.g., alcohol cessation, hepatitis treatment)

diseases.name: Colitis
diseases.description: Colitis is an inflammation of the colon, which can cause a range of symptoms depending on the underlying cause.
treatments: Surgery to remove the colon in severe cases

diseases.name: Conjunctivitis
diseases.description: Conjunctivitis, also known as pink eye, is an inflammation of the conjunctiva, which is the thin, clear tissue that lines the inside of the eyelid and covers the white part of the eye.
symptoms: Redness in the white of the eye or inner eyelid
Thick yellow discharge that crusts over the eyelashes, especially after sleep

diseases.name: Crohn's disease
diseases.description: Crohn's disease is a type of inflammatory bowel disease that can affect any part of the gastrointestinal tract from mouth to anus. Symptoms include abdominal pain, diarrhea, and weight loss.

diseases.name: Cystic fibrosis
diseases.description: Cystic fibrosis is an inherited disorder that causes severe damage to the lungs, digestive system and other organs in the body. It affects the cells that produce mucus, sweat and digestive juices.

diseases.name: Dementia
diseases.description: Dementia is a general term for a decline in mental ability severe enough to interfere with daily life. Memory loss is an example. Alzheimer's is the most common type of dementia.
symptoms: Inability to focus or pay attention

diseases.name: Diabetes mellitus
diseases.description: Diabetes mellitus is a chronic metabolic disorder characterized by high blood sugar levels due to the body's inability to produce or use insulin effectively.
symptoms: Tingling or numbness in the hands or feet
treatments: Regular check-ups with a healthcare provider

diseases.name: Emphysema
diseases.description: Emphysema is a lung disease that damages the air sacs in the lungs. This damage makes it harder to breathe and can lead to shortness of breath, coughing, and wheezing.
symptoms: Shortness of breath, especially during physical activities
treatments: Medications such as bronchodilators, inhaled steroids, or oxygen therapy

diseases.name: Endometriosis
diseases.description: Endometriosis is a condition where the tissue that normally lines the inside of the uterus grows outside of it, leading to pain and discomfort.
symptoms: Painful bowel movements or urination during menstruation
treatments: Pain relievers such as nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs)

diseases.name: Epilepsy
diseases.description: Epilepsy is a neurological disorder that causes seizures, which can range from mild to severe and affect different parts of the brain.
treatments: Surgery to remove the part of the brain causing seizures

diseases.name: Fibromyalgia
diseases.description: Fibromyalgia is a chronic condition that causes widespread pain and tenderness in the body, as well as fatigue, sleep disturbances, and cognitive difficulties.
treatments: Pain relievers such as acetaminophen, NSAIDs, or opioids

diseases.name: Gallstones
diseases.description: Gallstones are hardened deposits of digestive fluid that can form in the gallbladder, causing pain and other complications.
symptoms: Sudden and rapidly intensifying pain in the upper right portion of your abdomen
Pain in the back between the shoulder blades

diseases.name: Gastritis
diseases.description: Inflammation of the stomach lining

diseases.name: Glaucoma
diseases.description: Damage to the optic nerve that can lead to vision loss

diseases.name: Gout
diseases.description: A type of arthritis caused by a buildup of uric acid crystals in the joints

diseases.name: Hemorrhoids
diseases.description: Swollen veins in the anus and lower rectum

diseases.name: Hernia
diseases.description: A bulge or protrusion of an organ or tissue through an abnormal opening in the abdominal wall

diseases.name: Hiatal hernia
diseases.description: Hiatal hernia is a condition in which a portion of the stomach protrudes upward into the chest, through an opening in the diaphragm.

diseases.name: Inflammatory bowel disease
diseases.description: Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) is a group of chronic conditions that cause inflammation in the digestive tract.

diseases.name: Interstitial cystitis
diseases.description: Interstitial cystitis (IC) is a chronic condition that causes bladder pain and discomfort.

diseases.name: Irritable bowel syndrome
diseases.description: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) is a common condition that affects the large intestine.

diseases.name: Kidney stones
diseases.description: Kidney stones are hard deposits of minerals and salts that form inside the kidneys.
symptoms: Severe pain in the side and back, below the ribs
Pain that radiates to the lower abdomen and groin
treatments: Drinking water to help pass the stone

diseases.name: Leukemia
diseases.description: Leukemia is a type of cancer that affects the blood and bone marrow, the spongy tissue inside bones where blood cells are made.

diseases.name: Lymphoma
diseases.description: Lymphoma is a type of cancer that affects the lymphatic system, which is part of the body's immune system.

diseases.name: Macular degeneration
diseases.description: Macular degeneration is an eye disease that causes loss of vision in the center of the field of vision.
symptoms: Dark or empty areas in your central vision
Need for brighter light when reading or doing close work
Increased difficulty adapting to low light levels
Decreased intensity or brightness of colors

diseases.name: Menopause
diseases.description: Menopause is a natural biological process that marks the end of a woman's menstrual cycles.

diseases.name: Migraine headaches
diseases.description: Migraine headaches are a type of headache that typically cause intense throbbing pain in one area of the head, often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light and sound. They can last for hours or days and can be disabling.
symptoms: Throbbing or pulsing pain on one side of the head
treatments: Pain-relieving medications such as aspirin or ibuprofen
Triptans, which are medications specifically designed to treat migraines
Preventive medications such as beta blockers or antidepressants
Avoiding triggers such as certain foods, stress, and lack of sleep
Resting in a quiet, dark room

diseases.name: Multiple sclerosis
diseases.description: Multiple sclerosis (MS) is a chronic autoimmune disease of the central nervous system that affects the brain, spinal cord, and optic nerves.
symptoms: Numbness or tingling in the limbs
treatments: Medications to slow the progression of the disease

diseases.name: Myocardial infarction
diseases.description: Myocardial infarction (MI), also known as a heart attack, occurs when blood flow to the heart muscle is blocked, usually by a blood clot. This can cause damage to the heart muscle and potentially be life-threatening.
symptoms: Pain or discomfort in the arms, back, neck, jaw, or stomach
treatments: Thrombolytic therapy or percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) to restore blood flow
Beta blockers, ACE inhibitors, or other medications to prevent future heart attacks
Lifestyle changes such as quitting smoking, eating a healthy diet, and getting regular exercise

diseases.name: Osteoarthritis
diseases.description: Osteoarthritis (OA) is a degenerative joint disease that occurs when the protective cartilage on the ends of bones wears down over time, causing pain, stiffness, and loss of mobility.
symptoms: Pain or stiffness in the joints, especially after periods of inactivity or overuse
Swelling or tenderness in the affected joints
A crunching or popping sensation when moving the joint
treatments: Over-the-counter pain relievers such as acetaminophen or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs)
Prescription medications such as COX-2 inhibitors or corticosteroids
Assistive devices such as braces or canes
Lifestyle changes such as losing weight, getting regular exercise, and avoiding activities that exacerbate symptoms

diseases.name: Osteoporosis
diseases.description: Osteoporosis is a bone disease that occurs when the body loses too much bone, makes too little bone, or both. As a result, bones become weak and may break from a fall or, in serious cases, from sneezing or minor bumps.
symptoms: A bone that breaks much more easily than expected
treatments: Medications such as bisphosphonates, hormone therapy, and denosumab
Fall prevention measures, such as removing hazards and improving lighting in the home

diseases.name: Parkinson's disease
diseases.description: Parkinson's disease is a neurodegenerative disorder that affects movement. It occurs when the brain cells that produce dopamine, a chemical that coordinates movement, die or become impaired. As a result, people with Parkinson's disease may experience tremors, stiffness, slow movement, and difficulty with balance and coordination.
symptoms: Tremors or shaking, usually in the hands, arms, or legs
Stiffness or rigidity of the limbs and trunk
treatments: Medications that increase dopamine in the brain, such as levodopa, dopamine agonists, and MAO-B inhibitors
Deep brain stimulation (DBS), a surgical procedure that involves implanting electrodes in the brain
Physical therapy to improve movement and balance
Speech therapy to improve voice and communication
Occupational therapy to improve daily activities

diseases.name: Peptic ulcer disease
diseases.description: Peptic ulcer disease is a condition in which painful sores or ulcers develop in the lining of the stomach, small intestine, or esophagus.
treatments: Antibiotics to kill H. pylori bacteria
Proton pump inhibitors to reduce stomach acid
H2 blockers to reduce acid production
Lifestyle changes (e.g., avoiding alcohol and spicy foods)

diseases.name: Pneumonia
diseases.description: Pneumonia is an infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs, causing coughing, fever, and difficulty breathing.
treatments: Antibiotics to fight the underlying infection
Fever reducers (e.g., acetaminophen) to relieve symptoms
Oxygen therapy to help with breathing

diseases.name: Polycystic kidney disease
diseases.description: Polycystic kidney disease is an inherited disorder in which clusters of cysts develop within the kidneys, eventually causing kidney failure.
symptoms: Pain in the back or side
treatments: Blood pressure medications to control high blood pressure
Surgery to remove large cysts or to transplant a new kidney
Dialysis to remove waste from the blood if kidneys fail

diseases.name: Polycystic ovary syndrome
diseases.description: Polycystic ovary syndrome is a hormonal disorder that causes enlarged ovaries with small cysts on the outer edges, leading to infertility and other health problems.
treatments: Birth control pills to regulate periods and decrease androgen levels
Anti-androgen medications to reduce excess hair growth and acne
Metformin to improve insulin resistance and regulate menstrual cycles
Fertility treatments (e.g., in vitro fertilization) for those trying to conceive

diseases.name: Prostate Cancer
diseases.description: Prostate cancer is a type of cancer that develops in the prostate, a gland in the male reproductive system. It usually grows slowly and initially remains confined to the prostate gland, where it may not cause serious harm. However, in some cases, it can spread to other parts of the body and become more aggressive.
symptoms: Difficulty getting or maintaining an erection

diseases.name: Psoriasis
diseases.description: Psoriasis is a chronic skin condition that causes cells to build up rapidly on the surface of the skin. The extra skin cells form scales and red patches that are sometimes itchy and painful.
symptoms: Red patches of skin covered with thick, silvery scales
Dry, cracked skin that may bleed

diseases.name: Pulmonary embolism
diseases.description: Pulmonary embolism is a blockage in one of the pulmonary arteries in the lungs. The blockage is usually caused by a blood clot that travels to the lungs from another part of the body, most commonly the legs.
symptoms: Chest pain that gets worse with deep breathing or coughing

diseases.name: Rheumatoid arthritis
diseases.description: Rheumatoid arthritis is an autoimmune disorder that causes the body's immune system to attack the joints. This leads to inflammation and damage to the joints, which can cause pain, stiffness, and swelling.
symptoms: Swelling and tenderness in the joints

diseases.name: Rosacea
diseases.description: Rosacea is a chronic skin condition that causes redness, flushing, and sometimes small, red, pus-filled bumps on the face. It most commonly affects the nose, cheeks, forehead, and chin.
symptoms: Redness on the cheeks, nose, chin or forehead
Small visible blood vessels on the face
Bumps or pimples on the face

diseases.name: Sarcoidosis
diseases.description: Sarcoidosis is a disease that causes inflammation in different parts of the body, most commonly the lungs, lymph nodes, skin, and eyes. The inflammation can cause damage to these organs and may cause symptoms such as coughing, shortness of breath, and skin rashes.

diseases.name: Scoliosis
diseases.description: Scoliosis is a medical condition where the spine curves sideways. This can cause uneven shoulders, hips, or waist and can sometimes lead to discomfort or difficulty breathing.

diseases.name: Sinusitis
diseases.description: Sinusitis is an inflammation or swelling of the tissue lining the sinuses, which can cause symptoms such as facial pain, pressure, or congestion.

diseases.name: Spondylitis
diseases.description: Spondylitis is a type of arthritis that affects the spine and can cause stiffness, pain, and reduced mobility.
symptoms: Stiffness in the back or neck
Pain in the back or neck

diseases.name: Stroke
diseases.description: A stroke occurs when blood flow to the brain is interrupted or reduced, which can cause brain cells to die. This can result in various symptoms, depending on which part of the brain is affected.
symptoms: Sudden numbness or weakness in the face, arm, or leg, especially on one side of the body
Sudden confusion or trouble speaking or understanding speech
Sudden trouble seeing in one or both eyes
Sudden trouble walking, dizziness, loss of balance or coordination
Sudden severe headache with no known cause

diseases.name: Systemic lupus erythematosus
diseases.description: Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) is an autoimmune disease that can affect various parts of the body, including the skin, joints, kidneys, brain, and other organs.

diseases.name: Tendinitis
diseases.description: Tendinitis is a condition in which the tendons — the thick cords that attach muscles to bone — become inflamed or irritated.

diseases.name: Thyroid disease
diseases.description: Thyroid disease is a common problem that can cause symptoms due to over- or under-function of the thyroid gland.

diseases.name: Ulcerative colitis
diseases.description: Ulcerative colitis is a chronic inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) that causes inflammation and sores (ulcers) in the lining of the large intestine.

diseases.name: Varicose veins
diseases.description: Varicose veins are enlarged, twisted veins that are visible just under the surface of the skin. They usually occur in the legs, but can also form in other parts of the body.

diseases.name: Alzheimer's disease
diseases.description: Alzheimer's disease is a progressive brain disorder that affects memory, thinking, and behavior. It is the most common cause of dementia in older adults.

diseases.name: Angina pectoris
diseases.description: Angina pectoris is a condition that causes chest pain or discomfort. It occurs when the heart muscle doesn't get enough blood and oxygen due to narrowed or blocked coronary arteries.
symptoms: Pain or discomfort in the arms, neck, jaw, shoulder or back
treatments: Lifestyle changes such as quitting smoking, eating a healthy diet and exercising regularly
Medications to relieve pain and improve blood flow to the heart
Medical procedures such as angioplasty or bypass surgery

diseases.name: Aortic stenosis
diseases.description: Aortic stenosis is a condition that occurs when the aortic valve narrows, restricting blood flow from the heart to the rest of the body.
treatments: Balloon valvuloplasty to open the narrowed valve

diseases.name: Aortic valve regurgitation
diseases.description: Aortic valve regurgitation is a condition that occurs when the aortic valve doesn't close properly, causing blood to leak back into the heart.

diseases.name: Benign prostatic hyperplasia
diseases.description: Benign prostatic hyperplasia is a condition that causes the prostate gland to enlarge, leading to urinary problems.
treatments: Medications to relax the muscles of the prostate gland and improve urine flow
Minimally invasive procedures such as transurethral microwave therapy or laser therapy
Surgery to remove the prostate gland

diseases.name: Breast cancer
diseases.description: Breast cancer is a type of cancer that forms in the cells of the breast.
symptoms: A lump or thickening in the breast or underarm
Changes in the size or shape of the breast
treatments: Surgery to remove the cancerous tissue
Radiation therapy to destroy cancer cells
Chemotherapy or targeted therapy to kill cancer cells

diseases.name: Cardiomyopathy
diseases.description: Cardiomyopathy is a disease that affects the heart muscle, making it harder for the heart to pump blood to the rest of the body.
symptoms: Swelling of the legs, ankles, or feet

diseases.name: Carotid Artery Disease
diseases.description: Carotid artery disease occurs when the carotid arteries, which supply blood to the brain, become narrowed or blocked by plaque buildup.
symptoms: Weakness or numbness on one side of the body
treatments: Endarterectomy (surgical removal of plaque from artery)
Angioplasty and stenting (using a balloon to widen the artery and placing a stent to hold it open)

diseases.name: Cerebral Aneurysm
diseases.description: A cerebral aneurysm is a weakened, bulging area in the wall of an artery in the brain that can rupture and cause bleeding in the brain.
treatments: Observation and monitoring (for small, unruptured aneurysms)
Endovascular coiling (placing coils in the aneurysm to block blood flow)
Clipping (placing a clip on the base of the aneurysm to prevent it from rupturing)

diseases.name: Cervical Cancer
diseases.description: Cervical cancer is a type of cancer that occurs in the cells of the cervix, which is the lower part of the uterus that connects to the vagina.
treatments: Surgery (e.g., hysterectomy, removal of lymph nodes)

diseases.name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
diseases.description: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is a chronic lung disease characterized by obstruction of airflow from the lungs, making it difficult to breathe.
symptoms: Shortness of breath, especially during physical activities
treatments: Bronchodilators to relax the muscles around the airways
Pulmonary rehabilitation to improve lung function and overall fitness

diseases.name: Coronary artery disease
diseases.description: Coronary artery disease is a condition in which the arteries that supply blood to the heart become narrowed or blocked due to plaque buildup.
treatments: Lifestyle changes such as a healthy diet and exercise
Medications such as aspirin and statins
Procedures such as angioplasty or bypass surgery

diseases.name: Deep vein thrombosis
diseases.description: Deep vein thrombosis is a blood clot that forms in a vein deep inside the body, usually in the leg.
symptoms: Pain or tenderness in the affected leg
Warmth in the skin over the affected leg
Red or discolored skin over the affected leg
treatments: Anticoagulant medications to prevent the clot from getting bigger
Thrombolytic therapy to dissolve the clot
Compression stockings or devices to help prevent swelling and blood clots

diseases.name: Diverticulitis
diseases.description: Diverticulitis is a condition in which small pouches that form in the wall of the colon become infected or inflamed.
symptoms: Abdominal pain, usually on the left side
treatments: Liquid diet or low-fiber diet to help the colon rest
Surgery to remove the affected part of the colon in severe cases

diseases.name: Endocarditis
diseases.description: Endocarditis is an infection of the lining of the heart or heart valves.
symptoms: Swelling in the legs, feet, or abdomen
treatments: Surgery to repair or replace damaged heart valves
Anticoagulant medications to prevent blood clots

diseases.name: Esophageal cancer
diseases.description: Esophageal cancer is a type of cancer that begins in the cells that line the esophagus.
treatments: Palliative care to manage symptoms in advanced cases

diseases.name: Gallbladder cancer
diseases.description: Gallbladder cancer is a cancerous growth in the gallbladder, a small organ located beneath the liver that stores bile.

diseases.name: Gastroesophageal reflux disease
diseases.description: Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) is a chronic condition in which acid reflux occurs more than twice a week, causing inflammation and irritation of the esophagus.
treatments: Lifestyle changes (e.g., weight loss, avoiding trigger foods)

diseases.name: Glomerulonephritis
diseases.description: Glomerulonephritis is a type of kidney disease in which the tiny filters in the kidneys become inflamed and damaged, leading to kidney failure.
symptoms: Swelling in the face, hands, or feet
treatments: Medications to control blood pressure and reduce inflammation

diseases.name: Heart failure
diseases.description: Heart failure is a chronic condition in which the heart is unable to pump enough blood to meet the body's needs.
symptoms: Swelling in the legs, ankles, or feet
treatments: Medications to improve heart function and control symptoms
Lifestyle changes (e.g., reducing salt intake, exercising regularly)
Surgery (e.g., implanting a pacemaker, heart transplant)

diseases.name: Hodgkin's Lymphoma
diseases.description: Hodgkin's lymphoma is a cancer of the lymphatic system, which is part of the body's immune system.

diseases.name: Hyperthyroidism
diseases.description: Hyperthyroidism is a condition in which the thyroid gland produces too much thyroid hormone.

diseases.name: Hypothyroidism
diseases.description: Hypothyroidism is a condition in which the thyroid gland does not produce enough thyroid hormone.

diseases.name: Infectious Mononucleosis
diseases.description: Infectious mononucleosis, also known as mono or glandular fever, is a viral infection that causes fever, sore throat, and swollen lymph nodes.

diseases.name: Influenza
diseases.description: Influenza, commonly known as the flu, is a viral infection that affects the respiratory system.

diseases.name: Intestinal obstruction
diseases.description: Intestinal obstruction occurs when the small or large intestine is partially or completely blocked, leading to abdominal pain, bloating, vomiting, and constipation.

diseases.name: Ischemic heart disease
diseases.description: Ischemic heart disease is a condition where the heart muscle is not getting enough blood and oxygen due to a narrowing or blockage of the coronary arteries.
treatments: Medications to lower blood pressure and cholesterol
Angioplasty or coronary artery bypass surgery

diseases.name: Leukemia
diseases.description: Leukemia is a cancer of the blood cells, where abnormal white blood cells are produced in the bone marrow and interfere with the normal function of red blood cells and platelets.

diseases.name: Liver cancer
diseases.description: Liver cancer is a type of cancer that originates in the liver cells and can spread to other parts of the body.

diseases.name: Lung cancer
diseases.description: Lung cancer is a type of cancer that starts in the lungs and can spread to other parts of the body. It is often caused by smoking or exposure to harmful substances like radon or asbestos.

diseases.name: Mitral stenosis
diseases.description: Mitral stenosis is a narrowing of the heart's mitral valve, which separates the upper and lower chambers of the left side of the heart. This narrowing restricts blood flow from the left atrium to the left ventricle, which can lead to a variety of symptoms and complications.
symptoms: Swelling in the legs or feet
treatments: Surgical repair or replacement of the mitral valve
Lifestyle changes, such as maintaining a healthy weight and quitting smoking

diseases.name: Mitral valve regurgitation
diseases.description: Mitral valve regurgitation is a condition in which the heart's mitral valve doesn't close tightly, allowing blood to flow backward into the heart's upper chamber. This can lead to a variety of symptoms and complications.
symptoms: Swelling in the legs or feet
treatments: Medications to control blood pressure and reduce fluid buildup
Surgical repair or replacement of the mitral valve
Lifestyle changes, such as maintaining a healthy weight and quitting smoking

diseases.name: Myeloma
diseases.description: Multiple myeloma is a type of cancer that affects plasma cells, a type of white blood cell. The cancerous plasma cells can build up in the bone marrow and form tumors in bones throughout the body. Myeloma can cause a variety of symptoms and complications.

diseases.name: Non-Hodgkin's lymphoma
diseases.description: Non-Hodgkin's lymphoma is a type of cancer that affects the lymphatic system, which is a part of the body's immune system. The cancerous cells can accumulate in the lymph nodes, bone marrow, and other organs, leading to a variety of symptoms and complications.

diseases.name: Pancreatic Cancer
diseases.description: Pancreatic cancer is a type of cancer that begins in the cells of the pancreas. It can spread quickly and is often difficult to detect early. Pancreatic cancer is the fourth leading cause of cancer death in the United States.

diseases.name: Peptic ulcer disease
diseases.description: Peptic ulcer disease (PUD) is a condition where there is an erosion in the lining of the stomach or the first part of the small intestine.
treatments: Antibiotics to eliminate H. pylori bacteria
Proton pump inhibitors to reduce stomach acid production
H2 blockers to reduce stomach acid production

diseases.name: Peripheral arterial disease
diseases.description: Peripheral arterial disease (PAD) is a condition where there is a narrowing of the arteries that supply blood to the legs and feet.
symptoms: Coldness in lower leg or foot
Sores on toes, feet or legs that won't heal
treatments: Medications to manage symptoms and prevent blood clots
Angioplasty or stenting to open up blocked arteries

diseases.name: Pulmonary fibrosis
diseases.description: Pulmonary fibrosis (PF) is a condition where there is scarring or thickening of the tissue in the lungs, making it difficult for oxygen to pass through.
treatments: Oxygen therapy to increase oxygen levels
Pulmonary rehabilitation to improve lung function

diseases.name: Renal failure
diseases.description: Renal failure is a condition where the kidneys are no longer able to filter waste products from the blood.
symptoms: Swelling in hands, feet, and ankles
treatments: Dietary changes to manage electrolyte and fluid levels

diseases.name: Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS)
diseases.description: A progressive neurodegenerative disease that affects nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord, leading to muscle weakness and eventual paralysis.
treatments: Assistive devices to help with mobility and communication

diseases.name: Anemia
diseases.description: A condition in which the body lacks enough red blood cells or hemoglobin, leading to reduced oxygen supply to tissues and organs.
treatments: Supplements to increase iron or vitamin levels
Medications to stimulate red blood cell production

diseases.name: Anxiety disorders
diseases.description: A group of mental health disorders characterized by excessive worry, fear, or nervousness that interferes with daily activities.
treatments: Lifestyle changes to promote relaxation and stress management

diseases.name: Autism spectrum disorder
diseases.description: A neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by social, communication, and behavioral challenges that can vary widely in severity.
treatments: Behavioral therapy to teach social and communication skills
Lifestyle changes to support overall health and well-being

diseases.name: Autoimmune Disorders
diseases.description: Autoimmune disorders refer to a group of diseases in which the immune system attacks healthy cells in the body by mistake.

diseases.name: Bipolar Disorder
diseases.description: Bipolar disorder is a mental illness characterized by extreme mood swings, including episodes of mania and depression.

diseases.name: Blood Clotting Disorders
diseases.description: Blood clotting disorders refer to a group of conditions in which the blood clots too easily or doesn't clot enough, leading to an increased risk of bleeding or clotting.

diseases.name: Brain Tumors
diseases.description: Brain tumors refer to abnormal growths of cells in the brain that can be cancerous (malignant) or non-cancerous (benign).
symptoms: Changes in vision, hearing, or speech
Weakness or numbness on one side of the body

diseases.name: Cerebral Palsy
diseases.description: Cerebral palsy is a group of disorders that affect movement and muscle tone or posture. It is caused by damage that occurs to the immature brain as it develops, most often before birth.
treatments: Medications for muscle spasticity or seizures

diseases.name: Chronic kidney disease
diseases.description: Chronic kidney disease (CKD) is a condition characterized by a gradual loss of kidney function over time. It can lead to kidney failure if left untreated.
symptoms: Changes in urination (e.g., frequency, color, or smell)
treatments: Medications to control blood pressure and cholesterol levels
Dietary changes to manage potassium, sodium, and protein intake
Dialysis or kidney transplant in severe cases

diseases.name: Colorectal cancer
diseases.description: Colorectal cancer is a type of cancer that affects the colon and/or rectum. It often starts as a polyp, which can eventually become cancerous if left untreated.
symptoms: Changes in bowel habits (e.g., diarrhea or constipation)
treatments: Surgery to remove the cancerous tissue

diseases.name: Congenital heart defects
diseases.description: Congenital heart defects are abnormalities in the heart's structure that are present at birth. They can affect the heart's valves, chambers, or blood vessels.
symptoms: Swelling in the legs, abdomen, or areas around the eyes
Delayed growth and development (in infants and children)
treatments: Surgery to repair the heart defect

diseases.name: Depression
diseases.description: Depression is a mood disorder that can affect a person's thoughts, feelings, and behaviors. It can lead to feelings of sadness, hopelessness, and loss of interest in daily activities.
symptoms: Persistent feelings of sadness, anxiety, or emptiness
Loss of interest in activities that were once enjoyable
treatments: Brain stimulation therapies (e.g., electroconvulsive therapy or transcranial magnetic stimulation)

diseases.name: Down Syndrome
diseases.description: Down Syndrome is a genetic disorder that causes developmental and intellectual delays, as well as physical characteristics such as low muscle tone, upward slanting eyes, and a flat nasal bridge.

diseases.name: Eczema
diseases.description: Eczema is a chronic skin condition characterized by itchy, inflamed patches of skin. The cause of eczema is unknown, but it is thought to be related to an overactive immune system and a defective skin barrier.
symptoms: Small bumps that may leak fluid
treatments: Avoiding triggers (such as certain fabrics, soaps, or foods)

diseases.name: Erectile dysfunction
diseases.description: Erectile dysfunction is the inability to get or maintain an erection firm enough for sexual intercourse.
treatments: Oral medications such as sildenafil (Viagra), tadalafil (Cialis), or vardenafil (Levitra)

diseases.name: Graves' disease
diseases.description: Graves' disease is an autoimmune disorder that causes hyperthyroidism, or overactive thyroid.
treatments: Anti-thyroid medication such as methimazole or propylthiouracil
Surgery to remove the thyroid gland

diseases.name: Hashimoto's thyroiditis
diseases.description: Hashimoto's thyroiditis is an autoimmune disorder that causes hypothyroidism, or underactive thyroid.
treatments: Lifestyle changes such as a healthy diet and exercise
Avoiding certain foods such as soy and high-fiber foods

diseases.name: Hearing loss
diseases.description: Hearing loss is the partial or total inability to hear sounds.
symptoms: Muffling of speech and other sounds

diseases.name: Hemophilia
diseases.description: Hemophilia is a genetic disorder that affects the body's ability to clot blood, leading to excessive bleeding and easy bruising.
symptoms: Blood in the urine or stool
treatments: Desmopressin to increase the levels of clotting factors

diseases.name: High blood pressure (hypertension)
diseases.description: High blood pressure is a common condition in which the force of blood against your artery walls is consistently too high, which can eventually cause health problems, such as heart disease.
treatments: Lifestyle changes (e.g., healthy diet, regular exercise, stress management)
Medications (e.g., ACE inhibitors, diuretics, beta blockers)

diseases.name: High cholesterol
diseases.description: High cholesterol is a condition in which you have too much cholesterol — a waxy, fat-like substance — in your blood. High cholesterol can increase your risk of heart disease and other health problems.
symptoms: Xanthomas (fatty deposits) on the elbows, knees, and tendons
treatments: Lifestyle changes (e.g., healthy diet, regular exercise, quitting smoking)
Medications (e.g., statins, bile acid sequestrants, niacin)

diseases.name: Huntington's disease
diseases.description: Huntington's disease is a genetic disorder that causes the progressive breakdown of nerve cells in the brain, which leads to mental and physical disabilities.
treatments: Medications to control movement and psychiatric symptoms
Physical therapy to maintain mobility and prevent falls
Speech therapy to improve communication and swallowing

diseases.name: Juvenile idiopathic arthritis
diseases.description: Juvenile idiopathic arthritis is a type of arthritis that affects children under the age of 16. It causes joint pain, swelling, stiffness, and reduced mobility.
treatments: Medications to reduce inflammation and pain
Physical therapy to maintain joint mobility and strength
Occupational therapy to improve daily activities and quality of life

diseases.name: Lou Gehrig's disease
diseases.description: Lou Gehrig's disease, also known as amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), is a progressive neurodegenerative disease that affects nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord, leading to muscle weakness, paralysis, and eventually respiratory failure.
symptoms: Muscle weakness in hands, arms, legs or feet

diseases.name: Multiple myeloma
diseases.description: Multiple myeloma is a type of cancer that affects plasma cells, which are white blood cells that produce antibodies to help fight infections. In multiple myeloma, abnormal plasma cells accumulate in the bone marrow and can crowd out healthy blood cells.
symptoms: Bone pain, especially in the back or ribs

diseases.name: Muscular dystrophy
diseases.description: Muscular dystrophy is a group of genetic disorders that cause progressive weakness and degeneration of the muscles. Different types of muscular dystrophy have different patterns of inheritance and affect different muscles in the body.
treatments: Medications to improve muscle strength or delay progression of the disease

diseases.name: Myasthenia gravis
diseases.description: Myasthenia gravis is a neuromuscular disorder that causes muscle weakness and fatigue. It occurs when the immune system attacks the receptors that allow nerve impulses to reach the muscles, leading to difficulty controlling the affected muscles.
symptoms: Weakness in the muscles that control eye movement
Weakness in the arms, legs, or neck
treatments: Medications that suppress the immune system
Medications that improve nerve function or increase muscle strength
Plasmapheresis (a procedure that removes harmful antibodies from the blood)
Thymectomy (surgical removal of the thymus gland, which plays a role in the immune system)

diseases.name: Narcolepsy
diseases.description: Narcolepsy is a neurological disorder that affects the sleep-wake cycle. It causes sudden and uncontrollable sleepiness during the day, as well as other symptoms such as cataplexy (loss of muscle control during strong emotions) and hallucinations during sleep or wakefulness.
symptoms: Sleep paralysis (inability to move or speak when falling asleep or waking up)
treatments: Sodium oxybate (a medication that improves nighttime sleep and reduces daytime sleepiness)
Antidepressants or other medications to control cataplexy or hallucinations
Lifestyle changes to improve sleep hygiene (e.g., avoiding caffeine and alcohol, establishing a regular sleep schedule)

diseases.name: Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD)
diseases.description: Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease is a condition in which excess fat is stored in the liver. It is not caused by alcohol abuse, and can range from simple fat accumulation to inflammation and cirrhosis.
symptoms: Pain or discomfort in the upper right abdomen
Insulin resistance and high blood sugar
treatments: Lifestyle changes such as weight loss, exercise, and a healthy diet
Control of underlying conditions such as diabetes and high cholesterol
Medications such as vitamin E, pioglitazone, and ursodeoxycholic acid

diseases.name: Obesity
diseases.description: Obesity is a medical condition in which excess body fat has accumulated to the extent that it may have an adverse effect on health. It is a chronic disease that can lead to many other health problems.

diseases.name: Obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD)
diseases.description: Obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) is a mental disorder in which a person has uncontrollable, recurring thoughts (obsessions) and/or behaviors (compulsions) that he or she feels the urge to repeat over and over.

diseases.name: Ovarian cancer
diseases.description: Ovarian cancer is a cancer that forms in the ovaries. It is the fifth most common cancer among women.
symptoms: Difficulty eating or feeling full quickly

diseases.name: Paget's disease of bone
diseases.description: Paget's disease of bone is a chronic disorder that typically results in enlarged and deformed bones. It can affect any bone in the body, but most commonly affects the pelvis, spine, skull, and legs.

diseases.name: Peripheral artery disease (PAD)
diseases.description: Peripheral artery disease (PAD) is a common circulatory problem in which narrowed arteries reduce blood flow to your limbs.
symptoms: Painful cramping in hip, thigh or calf muscles after certain activities, such as walking or climbing stairs
Coldness in your lower leg or foot, especially when compared with the other side
Sores on your toes, feet or legs that won't heal
A change in the color of your legs
Hair loss or slower hair growth on your feet and legs
No pulse or a weak pulse in your legs or feet
Erectile dysfunction, especially in men with diabetes
treatments: Lifestyle changes such as regular exercise, smoking cessation, and healthy diet
Medications like blood thinners, cholesterol-lowering drugs, and medications to control blood pressure
Amputation of the affected limb, in severe cases

diseases.name: Peripheral neuropathy
diseases.description: Peripheral neuropathy is a condition that occurs when the nerves that carry information to and from the brain and spinal cord to the rest of the body are damaged or diseased.
symptoms: Tingling, burning or prickling sensations in the affected area
Muscle weakness or paralysis if motor nerves are affected
Partial or complete loss of sensation if sensory nerves are affected
Bowel or bladder dysfunction if autonomic nerves are affected
Changes in blood pressure and sweating
treatments: Treatment of the underlying condition that caused the neuropathy
Medications to relieve pain, such as over-the-counter painkillers, anti-seizure drugs, and antidepressants
Topical treatments like capsaicin cream or lidocaine patches
Physical therapy to help maintain strength and balance
Occupational therapy to help with everyday activities

diseases.name: Peyronie's disease
diseases.description: Peyronie's disease is a condition in which fibrous scar tissue develops inside the penis, causing curved, painful erections.
treatments: Medications like collagenase clostridium histolyticum to break down the scar tissue
Injections of verapamil or interferon to reduce the size of the plaque
Surgery, such as plication or grafting, to straighten the penis

diseases.name: Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)
diseases.description: Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) is a mental health condition triggered by a traumatic event such as combat, natural disasters, sexual assault or serious accidents. People with PTSD often experience flashbacks, nightmares, anxiety, and a feeling of detachment from the world.
symptoms: Flashbacks or reliving the traumatic event
Avoiding reminders of the traumatic event
Feeling numb or detached from the world
Negative changes in thinking or mood
treatments: Medications such as antidepressants or anti-anxiety drugs

diseases.name: Primary biliary cirrhosis
diseases.description: Primary biliary cirrhosis (PBC) is a chronic liver disease in which the small bile ducts in the liver are gradually destroyed, leading to a buildup of bile and damage to liver cells. The cause of PBC is unknown, but it is thought to be an autoimmune disorder.
treatments: Ursodeoxycholic acid (UDCA) to slow the progression of the disease
Medications to relieve itching or other symptoms

diseases.name: Primary sclerosing cholangitis
diseases.description: Primary sclerosing cholangitis is a chronic liver disease characterized by inflammation and scarring of the bile ducts. Over time, this can lead to liver damage and cirrhosis.

diseases.name: Raynaud's disease
diseases.description: Raynaud's disease is a condition that affects the blood vessels in the fingers and toes, causing them to narrow and reduce blood flow. This can lead to numbness, tingling, and color changes in the affected areas.
symptoms: Color changes in fingers and toes
treatments: Avoiding triggers such as cold temperatures and stress

diseases.name: Restless legs syndrome (RLS)
diseases.description: Restless legs syndrome is a condition that causes an uncontrollable urge to move the legs, often accompanied by uncomfortable sensations in the legs such as tingling, itching, or crawling.
symptoms: Tingling or crawling sensations in legs
treatments: Medications such as dopamine agonists and opioids
Lifestyle changes such as regular exercise and good sleep habits

diseases.name: Scleroderma
diseases.description: Scleroderma is a group of rare autoimmune diseases that cause the skin and connective tissues to harden and thicken. In some cases, scleroderma can also affect the internal organs such as the lungs, heart, and kidneys.

diseases.name: Sickle cell disease
diseases.description: Sickle cell disease is a genetic blood disorder that causes red blood cells to become misshapen and break down more easily than normal, leading to anemia and other complications.
treatments: Hydroxyurea to reduce the frequency of painful episodes

diseases.name: Sleep Apnea
diseases.description: Sleep apnea is a sleep disorder characterized by pauses in breathing or shallow breaths during sleep. The condition can lead to poor sleep quality and excessive daytime sleepiness.
symptoms: Episodes of breathing cessation during sleep witnessed by another person
treatments: Lifestyle changes (e.g. weight loss, quitting smoking, avoiding alcohol and sedatives)

diseases.name: AIDS
diseases.description: AIDS (Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome) is a disease caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), which attacks and weakens the immune system.

diseases.name: Anthrax
diseases.description: Anthrax is a serious bacterial infection caused by the spore-forming bacterium Bacillus anthracis, which can affect both humans and animals.

diseases.name: Avian influenza
diseases.description: Avian influenza, also known as bird flu, is a highly contagious viral infection that primarily affects birds but can also infect humans.

diseases.name: Bacterial meningitis
diseases.description: Bacterial meningitis is a serious infection of the meninges, which are the protective membranes that surround the brain and spinal cord.

diseases.name: Botulism
diseases.description: Botulism is a rare but serious bacterial infection caused by the toxin produced by the bacterium Clostridium botulinum, which can lead to paralysis and even death.

diseases.name: Brucellosis
diseases.description: Brucellosis is a bacterial infection that spreads from animals to people, usually through unpasteurized dairy products or contact with bodily fluids from infected animals.

diseases.name: Campylobacteriosis
diseases.description: Campylobacteriosis is a bacterial infection that causes diarrhea, abdominal pain, and fever. It is usually contracted through contaminated food, particularly undercooked poultry.

diseases.name: Candidiasis
diseases.description: Candidiasis is a fungal infection caused by the overgrowth of yeast. It can occur in various parts of the body, including the mouth, throat, genitals, and skin.
symptoms: White patches on the tongue or inside the mouth

diseases.name: Chagas disease
diseases.description: Chagas disease is a parasitic infection caused by the protozoan Trypanosoma cruzi. It is primarily found in Latin America, where it is transmitted to humans through the bite of infected triatomine bugs.

diseases.name: Chickenpox
diseases.description: Chickenpox is a highly contagious viral infection that causes an itchy rash and blisters. It is primarily spread through direct contact with an infected person or through airborne transmission.

diseases.name: Chlamydia
diseases.description: A common sexually transmitted infection caused by the bacterium Chlamydia trachomatis.

diseases.name: Cholera
diseases.description: An acute diarrheal illness caused by the bacterium Vibrio cholerae.

diseases.name: Coccidioidomycosis
diseases.description: A fungal infection caused by inhaling spores of the Coccidioides fungus.

diseases.name: Common cold
diseases.description: A viral infection of the upper respiratory tract.

diseases.name: Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease
diseases.description: A rare and fatal brain disorder caused by prions, abnormal proteins that damage brain cells.
treatments: There is no cure or treatment that can slow the progression of the disease

diseases.name: Cryptococcosis
diseases.description: Cryptococcosis is a fungal infection caused by Cryptococcus neoformans or Cryptococcus gattii. It can affect the lungs, brain, and other parts of the body.

diseases.name: Cryptosporidiosis
diseases.description: Cryptosporidiosis is a parasitic infection caused by the Cryptosporidium parasite. It can cause diarrhea, stomach cramps, nausea, and vomiting.

diseases.name: Cytomegalovirus infection
diseases.description: Cytomegalovirus (CMV) is a common virus that can infect people of all ages. Most people with CMV have no symptoms, but it can cause serious problems in people with weakened immune systems.

diseases.name: Dengue fever
diseases.description: Dengue fever is a viral infection transmitted by mosquitoes. It can cause a high fever, severe headache, joint and muscle pain, and a rash.

diseases.name: Diphtheria
diseases.description: Diphtheria is a bacterial infection that can cause severe respiratory and cardiac problems. It is spread through contact with an infected person or object.
symptoms: Formation of a thick grayish coating in the throat and nose

diseases.name: Ebola virus disease
diseases.description: Ebola virus disease (EVD) is a rare but severe illness caused by the Ebola virus.

diseases.name: Ehrlichiosis
diseases.description: Ehrlichiosis is a bacterial illness transmitted by ticks that causes flu-like symptoms.

diseases.name: E. coli infection
diseases.description: E. coli infection is a type of foodborne illness caused by consuming food or water contaminated with the bacteria E. coli.

diseases.name: Encephalitis
diseases.description: Encephalitis is inflammation of the brain, usually caused by a viral infection.

diseases.name: Enterovirus infection
diseases.description: Enterovirus infection is a viral illness that can cause a range of symptoms from mild to severe.

diseases.name: Erysipelas
diseases.description: Erysipelas is a bacterial skin infection that usually affects the legs, but can also occur on the face, arms and other parts of the body. It is caused by group A streptococcus bacteria and is characterized by redness, warmth, and swelling of the affected area.
symptoms: Redness, warmth, and swelling of the skin
Pain and tenderness in the affected area
treatments: Antibiotics, such as penicillin or erythromycin
Pain relievers, such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen
Elevating the affected limb to reduce swelling

diseases.name: Escherichia coli O157:H7 infection
diseases.description: Escherichia coli O157:H7 is a strain of E. coli bacteria that can cause severe foodborne illness. It is typically spread through contaminated food or water and can lead to symptoms such as abdominal pain, diarrhea, and dehydration. In severe cases, it can cause kidney failure and other complications.
treatments: Drinking plenty of fluids to prevent dehydration
Antibiotics are not recommended for treating E. coli O157:H7 infection as they can increase the risk of kidney damage
In severe cases, hospitalization may be necessary

diseases.name: Filariasis
diseases.description: Filariasis is a parasitic infection that is transmitted by mosquitoes. It can lead to a variety of symptoms, including fever, lymphedema, and elephantiasis. The infection is common in many tropical and subtropical regions of the world.
symptoms: Swelling of the limbs, genitalia, or breasts
treatments: Symptomatic treatment, such as pain relievers or antibiotics to treat secondary infections
Preventive measures, such as mosquito control measures and the use of bed nets

diseases.name: Giardiasis
diseases.description: Giardiasis is a diarrheal illness caused by the microscopic parasite Giardia.

diseases.name: Gonorrhea
diseases.description: Gonorrhea is a sexually transmitted infection caused by the bacterium Neisseria gonorrhoeae.

diseases.name: Group A streptococcal infection
diseases.description: Group A streptococcal infection is a bacterial infection caused by group A streptococcus.

diseases.name: Haemophilus influenzae infection
diseases.description: Haemophilus influenzae infection is a bacterial infection caused by Haemophilus influenzae.

diseases.name: Hantavirus pulmonary syndrome
diseases.description: Hantavirus pulmonary syndrome is a rare but serious respiratory disease caused by hantavirus.

diseases.name: Helminthiasis
diseases.description: Helminthiasis is a parasitic disease caused by helminths.

diseases.name: Hepatitis A
diseases.description: Hepatitis A is a highly contagious liver infection caused by the hepatitis A virus.

diseases.name: Hepatitis B
diseases.description: Hepatitis B is a viral infection that attacks the liver and can cause both acute and chronic disease.

diseases.name: Hepatitis C
diseases.description: Hepatitis C is a viral infection that causes liver inflammation, sometimes leading to serious liver damage.

diseases.name: Herpes zoster
diseases.description: Herpes zoster, also known as shingles, is a viral infection that causes a painful rash.
symptoms: Pain, burning, or tingling on one side of the body
A rash that appears as a band or stripe on one side of the body
Blisters that break open and crust over

diseases.name: Histoplasmosis
diseases.description: Histoplasmosis is a fungal infection caused by inhaling spores of the fungus Histoplasma capsulatum. It can cause flu-like symptoms and can be severe in people with weakened immune systems.

diseases.name: Hookworm infection
diseases.description: Hookworm infection is caused by parasitic worms that live in the intestines. It is commonly found in areas with poor sanitation and can lead to anemia and malnutrition.
symptoms: Itching and a rash at the site of infection

diseases.name: Human papillomavirus infection
diseases.description: Human papillomavirus (HPV) is a viral infection that can cause genital warts and increase the risk of developing certain cancers, including cervical cancer.

diseases.name: Impetigo
diseases.description: Impetigo is a highly contagious bacterial skin infection that causes sores and blisters. It is common in children and can spread easily through contact with the infected person.
symptoms: Red sores that quickly turn into blisters
Fluid-filled blisters that burst and develop honey-colored crusts
treatments: Keeping the affected area clean and covered

diseases.name: Influenza
diseases.description: Influenza, or the flu, is a viral infection that affects the respiratory system. It can cause fever, cough, body aches, and other symptoms, and can be serious in people with weakened immune systems or other health conditions.

diseases.name: Japanese encephalitis
diseases.description: Japanese encephalitis is a viral infection that is transmitted by mosquitoes and can cause inflammation of the brain.

diseases.name: Kawasaki disease
diseases.description: Kawasaki disease is an illness that primarily affects children and can cause inflammation in the blood vessels throughout the body.

diseases.name: Legionellosis
diseases.description: Legionellosis is a type of pneumonia caused by the Legionella bacteria.

diseases.name: Leishmaniasis
diseases.description: Leishmaniasis is a parasitic disease that is transmitted by the bite of infected sand flies.

diseases.name: Leprosy
diseases.description: Leprosy is a chronic bacterial infection that can damage the skin, nerves, and other organs.

diseases.name: Leptospirosis
diseases.description: Leptospirosis is an infection caused by bacteria of the Leptospira genus. It can cause a wide range of symptoms, from mild flu-like symptoms to severe disease involving multiple organs.

diseases.name: Listeriosis
diseases.description: Listeriosis is a serious infection caused by eating food contaminated with the bacterium Listeria monocytogenes. It can cause a variety of symptoms, from mild flu-like symptoms to severe disease involving the brain and other organs.

diseases.name: Lyme disease
diseases.description: Lyme disease is an infection caused by the bacterium Borrelia burgdorferi. It is transmitted to humans through the bite of infected blacklegged ticks. The symptoms of Lyme disease can vary widely, from mild flu-like symptoms to severe disease involving the heart, joints, and nervous system.

diseases.name: Malaria
diseases.description: Malaria is a life-threatening disease caused by parasites that are transmitted to people through the bites of infected female Anopheles mosquitoes. It can cause fever, chills, and flu-like symptoms, and can be a serious health risk if not treated promptly.

diseases.name: Measles
diseases.description: Measles is a highly contagious viral disease that can be serious or even fatal. It is spread through the air by coughing or sneezing. The symptoms of measles include fever, cough, runny nose, and a rash all over the body.
symptoms: Small white spots with bluish-white centers inside the mouth

diseases.name: Meningococcal disease
diseases.description: Meningococcal disease is a bacterial infection that can cause meningitis and sepsis. It is caused by the bacterium Neisseria meningitidis and is spread through respiratory and throat secretions.

diseases.name: Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) infection
diseases.description: MRSA is a type of staph infection that is resistant to many antibiotics. It can cause skin infections, pneumonia, and other infections. MRSA is spread through contact with contaminated surfaces or through skin-to-skin contact.
symptoms: Redness and swelling of the skin

diseases.name: Molluscum contagiosum
diseases.description: Molluscum contagiosum is a viral infection that causes small, raised, pearl-like bumps on the skin. It is spread through skin-to-skin contact and contact with contaminated objects.
symptoms: Small, raised bumps on the skin
White, waxy cores in the bumps

diseases.name: Monkeypox
diseases.description: Monkeypox is a rare viral disease that is similar to smallpox. It is spread through contact with infected animals or humans. Monkeypox can cause fever, rash, and pustules on the skin.

diseases.name: Mumps
diseases.description: Mumps is a viral infection that causes swelling of the salivary glands. It is spread through respiratory droplets and contact with contaminated surfaces. Mumps can also cause inflammation of the testicles, ovaries, and brain.

diseases.name: Mycobacterium avium complex infection
diseases.description: Mycobacterium avium complex (MAC) infection is a type of bacterial infection that commonly affects people with weakened immune systems, such as those with HIV/AIDS.

diseases.name: Mycoplasma pneumonia
diseases.description: Mycoplasma pneumonia is a type of bacterial pneumonia that affects the respiratory system.

diseases.name: Necrotizing fasciitis
diseases.description: Necrotizing fasciitis is a rare but serious bacterial infection that affects the soft tissue under the skin, including muscle and fat.

diseases.name: Neonatal tetanus
diseases.description: Neonatal tetanus is a type of tetanus that affects newborn babies. It is caused by exposure to the bacteria that produce tetanus toxin.
symptoms: Stiffness and spasms in the muscles

diseases.name: Norovirus infection
diseases.description: Norovirus infection is a type of viral infection that affects the stomach and intestines. It is highly contagious and can spread easily in crowded places.

diseases.name: Onchocerciasis
diseases.description: Onchocerciasis, also known as river blindness, is a parasitic disease caused by the worm Onchocerca volvulus. It is transmitted to humans through the bites of blackflies.

diseases.name: Ophthalmia neonatorum
diseases.description: Ophthalmia neonatorum is a form of conjunctivitis that occurs in newborn babies. It is usually caused by an infection acquired during delivery from the mother, who may have a sexually transmitted infection.
treatments: Preventive measures (e.g. screening and treating pregnant women for STIs)

diseases.name: Osteomyelitis
diseases.description: Osteomyelitis is a bone infection that can occur in any bone in the body. It is usually caused by bacteria that enter the bone through a wound or during surgery.
symptoms: Pain and tenderness in the affected area
treatments: Surgery (for severe cases or to remove dead tissue)

diseases.name: Paratyphoid fever
diseases.description: Paratyphoid fever is a bacterial infection caused by Salmonella Paratyphi bacteria. It is usually contracted by consuming contaminated food or water.

diseases.name: Pertussis
diseases.description: Pertussis, also known as whooping cough, is a highly contagious respiratory infection caused by the bacterium Bordetella pertussis. It can affect people of all ages, but is most dangerous for infants.
treatments: Antibiotics (to prevent the spread of the infection)
Supportive care (e.g. fluids, rest, and nutrition)

diseases.name: Pneumococcal disease
diseases.description: Pneumococcal disease is an infection caused by Streptococcus pneumoniae bacteria. It can lead to pneumonia, meningitis, and other infections.

diseases.name: Poliomyelitis
diseases.description: Poliomyelitis, also known as polio, is a highly contagious viral infection that can lead to paralysis, breathing problems, and even death.

diseases.name: Q fever
diseases.description: Q fever is a bacterial infection caused by Coxiella burnetii. It can cause fever, headaches, muscle aches, and pneumonia.

diseases.name: Rabies
diseases.description: Rabies is a deadly viral infection that is transmitted to humans through the bite of an infected animal, such as a dog or bat.

diseases.name: Respiratory syncytial virus infection
diseases.description: Respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) infection is a common respiratory infection that can cause serious illness, particularly in young children and older adults.

diseases.name: Rheumatic fever
diseases.description: Rheumatic fever is a complication of untreated strep throat. It can cause inflammation of the heart, joints, and other organs.

diseases.name: Rift Valley fever
diseases.description: Rift Valley fever is a viral disease that affects both humans and animals. It is most commonly found in sub-Saharan Africa.

diseases.name: Rocky Mountain spotted fever
diseases.description: Rocky Mountain spotted fever is a bacterial infection that is spread by ticks. It is most commonly found in North and South America.

diseases.name: Rotavirus infection
diseases.description: Rotavirus infection is a common cause of diarrhea in infants and young children. It can lead to dehydration and other complications.

diseases.name: Rubella
diseases.description: Rubella, also known as German measles, is a viral infection that can cause rash, fever, and swollen lymph nodes.

diseases.name: Salmonellosis
diseases.description: Salmonellosis is a bacterial infection that can cause diarrhea, fever, and abdominal cramps. Most people recover without treatment, but in some cases, it can lead to more severe illness.

diseases.name: SARS (severe acute respiratory syndrome)
diseases.description: SARS is a serious respiratory illness caused by the SARS coronavirus. It first appeared in Asia in 2003 and spread to several other countries. SARS can cause severe breathing problems, fever, and other symptoms.

diseases.name: Scabies
diseases.description: Scabies is a contagious skin condition caused by tiny mites that burrow into the skin. It causes intense itching and a rash.
symptoms: Rash (usually on the hands, feet, or genitals)
Small, raised bumps on the skin
treatments: Prescription medications to kill the mites

diseases.name: Scarlet fever
diseases.description: Scarlet fever is a bacterial infection that can cause a bright red rash, fever, sore throat, and other symptoms. It is most common in children between the ages of 5 and 15.
symptoms: Bright red rash (usually on the chest, stomach, and limbs)
Reddening of the tongue (known as "strawberry tongue")
treatments: Over-the-counter pain relievers (to reduce fever and discomfort)

diseases.name: Shigellosis
diseases.description: Shigellosis is an infection caused by the Shigella bacteria. It can cause diarrhea, fever, and stomach cramps. In severe cases, it can lead to dehydration and other complications.

diseases.name: Smallpox
diseases.description: Smallpox is a contagious disease caused by the variola virus. It is characterized by a fever and a distinctive rash.

diseases.name: Staphylococcal scalded skin syndrome
diseases.description: Staphylococcal scalded skin syndrome is a rare skin condition caused by the bacteria Staphylococcus aureus. It is characterized by redness and blistering of the skin.

diseases.name: Strep throat
diseases.description: Strep throat is a bacterial infection that affects the throat and tonsils. It is characterized by a sore throat, fever, and swollen lymph nodes.

diseases.name: Syphilis
diseases.description: Syphilis is a sexually transmitted infection caused by the bacteria Treponema pallidum. It is characterized by a sore or ulcer at the site of infection and a rash that can appear on the palms of the hands and soles of the feet.
symptoms: Rash on the palms of the hands and soles of the feet

diseases.name: Tetanus
diseases.description: Tetanus is a bacterial infection that affects the nervous system. It is characterized by muscle stiffness and spasms, particularly in the jaw muscles.

diseases.name: Toxoplasmosis
diseases.description: Toxoplasmosis is a parasitic infection caused by the Toxoplasma gondii parasite. It is usually transmitted through contact with contaminated cat feces, eating undercooked meat, or vertical transmission from mother to fetus during pregnancy.
symptoms: Flu-like symptoms (such as fever, fatigue, body aches)
Inflammation of the lungs, heart, or eyes (in severe cases)
treatments: Antibiotics (such as sulfadiazine, pyrimethamine, and clindamycin)
Corticosteroids (to reduce inflammation in severe cases)
Symptomatic treatment (such as pain relievers, fever reducers, and rest)

diseases.name: Trachoma
diseases.description: Trachoma is a bacterial infection of the eyes caused by the Chlamydia trachomatis bacterium. It is usually transmitted through contact with contaminated hands, clothing, or flies.
symptoms: Irritation and redness of the eyes
Formation of small bumps on the inner surface of the eyelids (in severe cases)
treatments: Facial cleanliness and environmental improvements (to prevent transmission)

diseases.name: Tuberculosis
diseases.description: Tuberculosis (TB) is a bacterial infection caused by the Mycobacterium tuberculosis bacterium. It usually affects the lungs, but can also affect other parts of the body.
treatments: Antibiotics (such as isoniazid, rifampin, and ethambutol)
Directly Observed Therapy (DOT) to ensure compliance with medication

diseases.name: Tularemia
diseases.description: Tularemia is a rare infectious disease caused by the bacterium Francisella tularensis.

diseases.name: Typhoid fever
diseases.description: Typhoid fever is a bacterial infection caused by Salmonella typhi.

diseases.name: Typhus
diseases.description: Typhus is a group of infectious diseases caused by bacteria called Rickettsia.

diseases.name: Urinary tract infection (UTI)
diseases.description: Urinary tract infection (UTI) is an infection in any part of the urinary system, including the kidneys, bladder, and urethra.

diseases.name: Varicella (chickenpox)
diseases.description: Varicella, commonly known as chickenpox, is a highly contagious disease caused by the varicella-zoster virus.

diseases.name: Vibrio infection
diseases.description: Vibrio infection is a bacterial infection caused by the Vibrio bacterium.

diseases.name: West Nile virus infection
diseases.description: West Nile virus (WNV) is a viral infection that typically spreads through the bite of an infected mosquito. Most people with WNV do not experience any symptoms. However, about 1 in 5 people who are infected will develop a fever along with other symptoms.
treatments: There is no specific treatment for WNV infection
Over-the-counter pain relievers can help reduce fever and relieve some symptoms
In severe cases, hospitalization may be necessary for supportive care, such as intravenous fluids, pain management, and nursing care

diseases.name: Adenoiditis
diseases.description: Adenoiditis is an inflammation of the adenoids, which are small pads of tissue located in the back of the throat.

diseases.name: Anal fissure
diseases.description: An anal fissure is a tear in the lining of the anus, which can cause pain and bleeding during bowel movements.
symptoms: Itching or burning around the anus

diseases.name: Bursitis
diseases.description: Bursitis is an inflammation of the bursae, which are small sacs of fluid that cushion the joints and reduce friction between bones and soft tissues.
symptoms: Stiffness and limited range of motion

diseases.name: Cholecystitis
diseases.description: Cholecystitis is an inflammation of the gallbladder, which is a small organ located near the liver that stores bile.
treatments: Surgery to remove the gallbladder in severe cases

diseases.name: Chronic bronchitis
diseases.description: Chronic bronchitis is a type of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) that causes inflammation and narrowing of the airways in the lungs.

diseases.name: Cirrhosis of the liver
diseases.description: Cirrhosis is a late stage of scarring of the liver caused by long-term liver damage. It can lead to liver failure and other complications such as bleeding, infections, and liver cancer.
symptoms: Spider-like blood vessels on the skin
treatments: Dietary changes to limit salt and fluid intake

diseases.name: Congestive heart failure
diseases.description: Congestive heart failure occurs when the heart is unable to pump enough blood to meet the body's needs. It can lead to symptoms such as shortness of breath, fatigue, and swelling in the legs and ankles.
symptoms: Swelling in the legs, ankles, or feet
treatments: Medications to manage symptoms and improve heart function
Lifestyle changes such as diet and exercise
Implantation of devices such as pacemakers or defibrillators

diseases.name: Dental caries
diseases.description: Dental caries, also known as tooth decay, is a common dental problem caused by the breakdown of tooth enamel by bacteria. It can lead to pain, infection, and tooth loss if left untreated.
symptoms: Toothache or pain when eating or drinking
Sensitivity to hot or cold temperatures
Visible holes or pits in the teeth
Bad breath or a bad taste in the mouth
treatments: Root canal therapy to treat infections

diseases.name: Heart Attack
diseases.description: A heart attack occurs when the blood flow to the heart muscle is blocked, usually by a blood clot. This can cause damage to the heart muscle and can be life-threatening.
symptoms: Upper body pain or discomfort in the arms, back, neck, jaw, or stomach

diseases.name: Insomnia
diseases.description: Insomnia is a sleep disorder that makes it difficult to fall asleep or stay asleep.

diseases.name: Intervertebral disc herniation
diseases.description: Intervertebral disc herniation is a condition in which the jelly-like center of a spinal disc pushes through a crack in the tough outer layer and puts pressure on the nerves near the spine.
symptoms: Numbness or tingling in the legs or feet

diseases.name: Jaundice
diseases.description: Jaundice is a condition that causes yellowing of the skin and whites of the eyes due to a buildup of bilirubin, a yellow pigment produced by the liver.
symptoms: Yellowing of the skin and whites of the eyes

diseases.name: Nasal polyps
diseases.description: Nasal polyps are noncancerous growths that develop in the lining of the nose or sinuses.

diseases.name: Otitis media
diseases.description: Otitis media is an infection or inflammation of the middle ear, which is the space behind the eardrum that contains the small bones that vibrate in response to sound.

diseases.name: Rectal cancer
diseases.description: Rectal cancer is a type of cancer that occurs in the cells of the rectum, which is the last section of the large intestine.

diseases.name: Sciatica
diseases.description: Sciatica is a type of pain that affects the sciatic nerve, which runs from the lower back down to the legs and feet.
symptoms: Pain in the lower back, buttocks, and legs
Numbness or tingling in the legs or feet

diseases.name: Skin cancer
diseases.description: Skin cancer is a type of cancer that occurs in the cells of the skin.
symptoms: Changes in the appearance of moles or other skin lesions
A new growth on the skin
Pain, itching, or bleeding on the skin

diseases.name: Spinal stenosis
diseases.description: Spinal stenosis is a narrowing of the spaces within the spine, which can put pressure on the nerves that travel through the spine.
symptoms: Pain or numbness in the legs or arms
Weakness in the legs or arms
Loss of bowel or bladder control

diseases.name: Stomach cancer
diseases.description: Stomach cancer is a type of cancer that occurs in the cells of the stomach.
symptoms: Feeling full after eating small amounts of food

diseases.name: Testicular cancer
diseases.description: Testicular cancer occurs when abnormal cells in the testicles grow and divide uncontrollably, forming a mass or tumor.
symptoms: A painless lump or swelling in the testicle
A feeling of heaviness in the scrotum
A dull ache in the abdomen or groin
treatments: Surgery to remove the affected testicle (orchiectomy)

diseases.name: Thyroid cancer
diseases.description: Thyroid cancer is a type of cancer that starts in the cells of the thyroid gland, which is located in the front of the neck.
symptoms: A lump or swelling in the neck
Pain in the neck or throat
treatments: Surgery to remove all or part of the thyroid gland

diseases.name: Tinnitus
diseases.description: Tinnitus is a condition where a person hears a ringing, buzzing, or other noise in one or both ears that is not caused by an external sound.
symptoms: Ringing, buzzing, or other noise in the ears
treatments: Identifying and treating underlying causes (e.g., earwax buildup, high blood pressure)
Using a white noise machine or other sound therapy
Counseling or therapy to help manage anxiety or depression

diseases.name: Uterine cancer
diseases.description: Uterine cancer is a type of cancer that starts in the cells of the uterus (womb), which is a hollow organ in the female reproductive system.
symptoms: Abnormal vaginal bleeding (e.g., bleeding between periods, after menopause)
treatments: Surgery to remove the uterus (hysterectomy) and/or other affected organs

diseases.name: Venous insufficiency
diseases.description: Venous insufficiency is a condition where the veins in the legs are unable to pump blood back up to the heart effectively, leading to swelling, pain, and other symptoms.
symptoms: Swelling in the legs, ankles, or feet
Pain, aching, or cramping in the legs
treatments: Elevating the legs when sitting or lying down
Medications to improve blood flow or prevent blood clots

diseases.name: Vertigo
diseases.description: Vertigo is a sensation of spinning dizziness that can occur without any movement. It is often caused by problems with the inner ear or brain.

diseases.name: Vitiligo
diseases.description: Vitiligo is a condition that causes the skin to lose its pigment, resulting in white patches on the skin. It occurs when the cells that produce pigment in the skin are destroyed.
symptoms: Premature whitening of hair on scalp, eyelashes, eyebrows or beard
Loss of color inside the mouth
Loss or change in color of the retina

diseases.name: Whiplash
diseases.description: Whiplash is a neck injury that occurs when the head is suddenly jerked backward and then forward, causing damage to the soft tissues in the neck.

diseases.name: Wilson's disease
diseases.description: Wilson's disease is a rare genetic disorder that causes copper to accumulate in the liver, brain and other organs. This can lead to liver disease, neurological problems and psychiatric symptoms.

diseases.name: Yeast infection
diseases.description: A yeast infection is a common fungal infection caused by the overgrowth of the Candida fungus.
symptoms: Swelling and redness of the vulva
White, thick, odorless vaginal discharge with a cottage cheese-like appearance

diseases.name: Zika virus infection
diseases.description: Zika virus is a mosquito-borne virus that can cause mild to severe symptoms, including fever, rash, joint pain, and red eyes. It can also cause birth defects in infants born to infected mothers.
treatments: Pregnant women should avoid travel to areas with ongoing Zika virus outbreaks

diseases.name: goodbye
treatments: See you later, thanks for visiting

diseases.name: thanks
treatments: You're welcome! It was my pleasure to help.
No problem! Glad I could be of assistance.
You're welcome! Let me know if you need help with anything else.

diseases.name: about_you
treatments: I'm Pulse, a symptom checker and healthcare assistant. I'm here to help you identify and better understand your symptoms, and provide you with personalized guidance on next steps.
